channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report X-2024081503
item.description:
Report X-2024081503

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-20
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS LEAKED ON BY ANOTHER PACKAGE IN THE SORT. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY TWO KILOGRAMS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING MEAT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. OUTER BOX IS MARKED THIS SIDE UP, PERISHABLE, AND FREEZE OR REFRIGERATE UPON ARRIVAL. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024080504
item.description:
Report E-2024080504

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) cup of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pail that impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and containerized the spent absorbents into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail. The generated waster was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080503
item.description:
Report E-2024080503

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-17
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: USPS PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING AT THE UPS FACILITY IN ROCKFORD, ILLINOIS. OUTER PACKAGE INSPECTION REVEALS ONE USPS PRIORITY MAIL BOX THAT HAS BEEN PARTIALLY DESTROYED WITH SEVERAL AEROSOL CANS OF SPRAYWAY GLASS CLEANER SPILLING OUT OF THE BOX. IT APPEARS THE CAPS OF ONE OR MORE OF THE AEROSOL CANS HAD COME OFF EXPOSING AND ENGAGING THE NOZZLE RELEASING THE PRODUCT INSIDE THE BOX. THE PACKAGE BEGAN TO DETERIORATE AND ULTIMATELY BROKE OPEN. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER USPS BOX TO INDICATE DANGEROUS GOODS WERE BEING SHIPPED. THE PACKAGE TRAILERED INTO THE UPS ROCKFORD FACLITY AND WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING PRIOR TO FLIGHT ON UPS AIRCRAFT. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024080502
item.description:
Report E-2024080502

  • Description: USPS PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING AT THE UPS FACILITY IN ROCKFORD, ILLINOIS. OUTER PACKAGE INSPECTION REVEALS ONE USPS PRIORITY MAIL BOX THAT HAS BEEN PARTIALLY DESTROYED WITH FOUR AEROSOL CANS OF SPRAYWAY GLASS CLEANER SPILLING OUT OF THE BOX. IT APPEARS ONE OR MORE OF THE AEROSOL CANS LEAKED CAUSING THE BOX TO DETERIORATE AND BREAK OPEN. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THER OUTER USPS BOX TO INDICATE DANGEROUS GOODS WERE BEING SHIPPED. THE PACKAGE TRAILERED INTO THE UPS FACLITY AND WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING PRIOR TO FLIGHT ON UPS AIRCRAFT. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER FOUND A WET HAZMAT PLACED ON THE DMP TABLE. RESPONDER DONNED FULL PPE (BAGGS) AND BROUGHT DECISION TREE AND SPILL CART SUPPLIES. THE BOX WAS WET ON THE BOTTOM. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET FOR A LEAKING FLAMMABLE LIQUID AND OPENED THE BOX TO SEE IT WAS A METAL BUCKET THAT HAD SLIGHTLY LEAKED BECAUSE IT WAS DENTED.

item.title: Report I-2024070103
item.description:
Report I-2024070103

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: LEMONT
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Trailer was loaded at Rowell in Willow Springs on 06/20/2024 with hydrochloric acid 28% and parked for the next day's delivery. On 6/21/2024, driver went to make delivery to customer in University Park, IL. Driver could not get valves to open due to an issue with the air switches not fully opening the internal valve. This is when the trailer was brought to B&R for repairs. When the driver arrived at B&R he stopped and went into the office to check the trailer in, he came out and found HCL leaking from the pump cabinet onto the ground. Driver immediately went to seek out the source of the leak he found it to be leaking from a flange in the piping from the internal valve to the pump. He stopped the leak and began the neutralization process and reported it the repair shop. The repair shop helped the driver to neutralize the spill and clean it up. Driver estimated 5-8 gallons of hydrochloric acid 28% was lost. Trailer's leak was stopped, and the trailer was brought to a contained area to be pumped out. Once the trailer was emptied it was washed out and brought in for necessary repairs. It was found the secondary and internal valve failed. It was also found the flange gasket from the internal to the pump was the incorrect material.

item.title: Report E-2024080440
item.description:
Report E-2024080440

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-13
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO CNW, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 13, 2024, at 0457 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by XPO personnel in La Salle, Arkansas regarding the release of Micronic 725 S (UN3266 Corrosive Liquid, Basic, inorganic, n.o.s., 8, II). Hepaco contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors observed approximately 2 ounces released from (1) 275-gallon IBC plastic tote. The release was caused by a loose cap and impacted the top of the tote and cardboard. Contractors wiped down the impacted area and tightened the cap. The spent rags and impacted cardboard was placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal. approximately (2) ounces of CRW 9220 Corrosion Inhibitor (Flammable liquid, toxic, n.o.s., (Methanol, Isopropanol), UN1992, 3, 6.1, III) from (7) 55-gallon poly drums. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was contained to the tops of the drums only, contractors wiped down the totes and tightened the drum caps so the cargo could be forwarded on to the original consignee. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon poly drum which was then taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal. IF NO RELEASE Contractors were unable to locate any damaged cargo. No waste was generated from this event.

item.description:
Report E-2024080369

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-12
  • City: EAST SAINT LOUIS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 12, 2024, at 1321 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in East St. Louis, Illinois regarding the release of Eterset 2950 (UN1866, Resin Solution, 3, III). Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 5 ounces of ETERSET 2950 from (1) 55-gallon DM that impacted a 5ft x 5ft area of the trailer floor. Contractors could not determine the cause of the release. Contractors placed the damaged drum with residual product in an overpack to be forwarded on to the original consignee, then cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in (1) 5-gallon DF and taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080383
item.description:
Report E-2024080383

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-31
  • City: FRANKFORT
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 31, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1263 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 85-gallon salvage drum. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor and swept them in with hand tools, and all impacted freight was wiped down with absorbent pads and cleaners. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.
